outputs.output_descr:
1) Translation and production of anti-corruption knowledge and information products (including online products) increased access to knowledge and information on anti-corruption
2) UNDP leadership, advocacy and coordination role enhanced through partnerships, joint knowledge products, joint scoping missions and support to regional initiatives
3) Demand for anti-corruption interventions increased through media and civil society organization
4) Awareness and utilization of nationally-owned anti-corruption assesment tools in four countries
5) State/institutional capacity to respond to carry out anti-corruption interventions increased through training and provision of advisory technical support at least to 20 countries

1.	The support is provided to designing and implementation of projects to improve service delivery and remove the bottlenecks in MDG acceleration pilot countries.
2.	Sectoral approach to fighting corruption developed and implemented in selected countries.
3.	Multi-stakeholder networks and dialogues held in at least three countries.
4.	In order to ensure sustainability, an anti-corruption course for UNDAF training is developed.
5.	The technical assistance for UNCAC implementation and anti-corruption interventions is provided on the request of programming countries.
6.	The support to strengthen the capacity of the select anti-corruption agencies is provided.
7.	The UNCAC and anti-corruotion is mainstreamed in national development processes, governance programming, and transition and recovery plans
